page.title: 07General Description (Cont)
page.content: The religion of the area is strongly non_conformist in character.It contains 7 non_conformist chapels but only 2 Anglican churches and only one Roman Catholic church.Recently,however ,a sect of the Jehovah Witnesses has developed strongly in the area. Of historical intrest is the chapel known as "{HEN SOAR}"(Old Soar).Built in 1834,it was the first Methodist chapel in Pontyberem and the close connection between the Methodists and Anglicans is illustrated by the fact that Hen Soar possesses a belfrey-more commonly found in churches.Of some historical interest also is {Mynachlog {Terrace}in block{D7.}The Welsh word "Mynachlog"means monastery and the terrace,built in 1875,has,so local tradition has it,been built on land belonging to a local monastery.There is also a" {Mynachlog Farm}" (see p.8)
